      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignRoboticon(Roboticon roboticon)
      Adds a Roboticon to the roboticon list.
      void drawBorder()
      Draws the tile's coloured border on the game's stage This must be called during the construction of each frame in which the border is to be shown Note that the border must only be shown if the tile is owned by someone
      void drawTooltip()
      Draws the tile's tooltip on the game's stage Specifically draws the tooltip region in the space to the top- or bottom-left of the cursor's position (depending on how high up the cursor is in the game's window) before drawing textual and visual contents inside that region This must be called during the construction of each frame in which the tooltip is to be shown

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(com.badlogic.gdx.Game game,
            int ID,
            int EnergyCount,
            int OreCount,
            int FoodCount,
            java.lang.String surfaceGraphic,
            java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Construct's the tile's visual interface and logical underpinnings. Sets the sizes of the tile's associated tooltip and border before setting its resource yields and implementing Listeners to detect when the tile is clicked on (for individual tile selection) and hovered over (to determine when the tile's tooltip should be drawn).
        Parameters:
        game - Variable storing the game's state
        ID - The tile's distictive getID value
        EnergyCount - The multiplier for the production of energy
        OreCount - The multiplier for the production of ore
        FoodCount - The multiplier for the production of food
        surfaceGraphic - A string to signify what the graphics of the tile are.
        runnable - An object encapsulating a method that can be executed when the tile is clicked on

    • Method Detail

      • produce

        public void produce()
        Calculates how many resources are produced based on the amount of roboticons present and adds them to the player.

      • getResource

        public int getResource(ResourceType type)
                throws InvalidResourceTypeException
        Unified Getter for resource amounts
        Parameters:
        type - resource requested
        Returns:
        int value representing the amount of type the player currently have
        Throws:
        InvalidResourceTypeException

        public void setResource(ResourceType type,
                        int newCount)
        Unified Setter for resource amounts
        Parameters:
        type - resource being set
        newCount - int value the count should be updated to

      • runFunction

        public void runFunction()
        Runs the tile's associated function

      • drawTooltip

        public void drawTooltip()
        Draws the tile's tooltip on the game's stage Specifically draws the tooltip region in the space to the top- or bottom-left of the cursor's position (depending on how high up the cursor is in the game's window) before drawing textual and visual contents inside that region This must be called during the construction of each frame in which the tooltip is to be shown

      • drawTooltipContents

        private void drawTooltipContents(int y)

      • drawBorder

        public void drawBorder()
        Draws the tile's coloured border on the game's stage This must be called during the construction of each frame in which the border is to be shown Note that the border must only be shown if the tile is owned by someone

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns the tile's associated getID value
        Returns:
        int The tile's associated getID value

      • isOwned

        public boolean isOwned()
        Returns a boolean value that's true if/when the tile is owned by a player and false otherwise
        Returns:
        Boolean The ownership status of the tile

      • setTileBorderColor

        public void setTileBorderColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
        Sets the colour of the tile's border This must only be called if and when a player acquires the tile
        Parameters:
        color - The new colour of the tile's border
